which value Alice has committed to."],"className":"my-12"}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":["The second phase is the ",["$","em",null,{"children":"reveal"}]," phase, in which the bit committed by 94:["$","p",null,{"children":"In intuitive, operational terms, the first phase of bit commitment should function as if Alice writes a binary value on a piece of paper, locks the paper inside of a safe, and gives the safe to Bob while keeping the key for herself.\nAlice has committed to the binary value written on the paper because the safe is in Bob's possession (so it's binding), but because Bob can't open the safe he can't tell which value Alice committed to (so it's concealing).\nThe second phase should work as if Alice hands the key to the safe to Bob, so that he can open the safe to reveal the value to which Alice committed.","className":"group paragraph-el text-text-primary mx-0"}]
